summary: The First Order Is Here with A New Trooper
title: The First Order Is Here with A New Trooper
body:
After we saw the First Order gain control of The Colossus, we had to get ready for some people acting against it. It’s Newton’s law, after all: every action causes reaction of equal measure. And as the series is titled Star Wars: Resistance, it’s fairly obvious we will see that reaction.

So, the key moment is not the reaction per se; it’s how we’ll be made to know about it.

Keep Reading

tags: i try not to think about the fact that palpatine is from naboo
i refuse to think about that
summary: 2, 3, and 7, please?
question: 2, 3, and 7, please?
answer:
2. second favorite movie

(answered here)

3. favorite planet

Naboo!  It’s absolutely gorgeous, vibrant, and its culture reminds me of India sometimes (which makes me so happy).

7. favorite outfit

I already answered this, but I’ll mention some more favorite outfits!  I really like the dress Leia wore to Bespin.  It’s really simple yet pretty, and the colors are so nice on her.

(star wars asks!)

summary: Forgiveness
title: Forgiveness
description:
by ms_nawilla

Follows ‘Tomorrow’. The people Obi-Wan left behind deal with tragedy, love and what happens when conflicts are left unresolved.

Words: 6493, Chapters: ¼, Language: English

Series: Part 3 of Try

  • Fandoms: Star Wars - All Media Types, Star Wars Prequel Trilogy
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Garen Muln, Reeft (Star Wars), Bant Eerin, Qui-Gon Jinn, Obi-Wan Kenobi, Mace Windu, Anakin Skywalker, Leia Organa, Han Solo, Tahl (Star Wars), Yoda (Star Wars), Bail Organa
  • Relationships: Garen Muln/Reeft, Qui-Gon Jinn/Obi-Wan Kenobi, Qui-Gon Jinn & Anakin Skywalker, Qui-Gon Jinn & Tahl (Star Wars), Obi-Wan Kenobi & Garen Muln, Bant Eerin & Reeft, Qui-Gon Jinn & Mace Windu, Obi-Wan Kenobi/Garen Muln/Reeft

  • Relationships: Garen Muln/Reeft, Qui-Gon Jinn/Obi-Wan Kenobi, Qui-Gon Jinn & Anakin Skywalker, Qui-Gon Jinn & Tahl (Star Wars), Obi-Wan Kenobi & Garen Muln, Bant Eerin & Reeft, Qui-Gon Jinn & Mace Windu, Obi-Wan Kenobi/Garen Muln/Reeft
  • Additional Tags: Grief/Mourning, Wakes & Funerals, Birthday Parties from Hell, Interspecies Relationship(s), Threesome, Loss of Virginity, Injury, Disability, Aftermath of Torture, torture (offscreen), Rape/Non-con Elements, Dubious Consent, Estrangement, Forgiveness, Mental Health Issues, Memories, Jedi turned to the Dark Side, Medication, Promotion, Unresolved Issues

blog.name: alice-blogs-things
blog.title: Ashes To Ashes Trash
blog.description: Hi, I'm Alice. I'm nineteen and I'm from Scotland. This blog is honestly a mess right now. She/her pronouns, possibly bi, I'm really not sure. Currently Galex trash with a sprinkling of Doctor Who and a dash of many other fandoms.

summary: Star Wars Characters As John Mulaney Quotes
body:
Star Wars Characters As John Mulaney Quotes

Luke: I don’t look like someone who’s done anything. I look like someone who’s just sat on a chair in a room eating saltines for nineteen years and came out here.

Leia: You know how I’m filled with rage?

Han: They’re like, did that work? And I’m like, it didn’t not work!

Darth Vader: My boss looked at me and said, “you have the moral backbone of a chocolate eclair.”

Chewie: Fuck da police!

Obi-Wan: Whatever, you know those days where you’re like, this might as well happen?

Anakin: This is an on fire garbage can.

Padme: I try to stay optimistic, but I will admit, things are looking pretty sticky.

Yoda: One feels like a duck, splashing about in all this wet! And when one feels like a duck, one is happy! *pauses* Too old for ducklings, quack quack!

Rey: I am very small, and I have no money. So you can imagine the kind of stress that I am under.

Finn: I have a girlfriend now, which is weird because I’m probably gay based on the way I have walked and talked and acted my whole life.

Poe: Some people have a vibe of “don’t fuck with me.”

Rose: My vibe is more, “hey, you could pour soup into my lap and I’d probably apologise to you.”

Kylo Ren: In more personal news, let’s talk about my dad.

Hux: You want me to do what?

Phasma: Shut up, you’re all gonna die, street smarts!

blog.name: somecynicalanimator
blog.title: Some Cynical Animator
blog.description: This blog is a personal repository for the work I will be producing as an Animation student, as well as my notes and research. I hope you like it! Vimeo: vimeo.com/user90362632, YouTube: youtube.com/channel/UC0r7-Ka4U1jmeYd7kYwFVmA.

summary: Module - Intro to Making Of During today’s session, we watched clips from the behind the scenes documentary for Star Wars...
body:
Module - Intro to Making Of

During today’s session, we watched clips from the behind the scenes documentary for Star Wars Episode 3: Revenge of the Sith (2005). It documented the process by which the movie developed, from the script, to storyboarding/model making, shooting, C.G.I. animation for special effects and the backgrounds. I spent time today trying to figure out whether, when animating in ToonBoom Harmony, I would either animate with a 2-D rig or frame-by-frame, ultimately choosing to animating frame-by-frame. It was strongly recommended to me that I produce a Turnaround of my dog character, to get a sense of the dimensions and weight of the dog. Based upon my idea for this animation, I may have to start trying to produce anatomical drawings, in order to get a good sense of how to draw realistic animals; one thing I think I should start doing for this is to attend Life Drawing sessions, to see if I can transfer what I learn there, plus research on drawing anatomically correct dogs, into my animation. Although I could just try to make a more cartoonish, stylised animation. Following this realisation, I watched a number of different videos, such as a video titled How to Animate for Beginners, in which I learned the basics of using digital programs to animate (Hoping that this may be transferable to ToonBoom).

I recently decided to attend a Life Drawing session. It involved drawing a person modelling, using two pencils. Using a pencil to measure the proportions of the model, I was able to mark out certain details with the lighter of the two pencils, giving me the basic measurements I needed to work with. We learned about charcoal/painting shades into a drawing, allowing to convey 3-D depth. I never got to put these particular things into practice, as I spent the session focusing on figure drawing, without adding extra details. We learned about the use of basic lines before drawing an image, applying line down the middle of the figure in order to keep a consistent sense of gravity, while also applying a line of action in order to keep the poses consistent with what we can see, fixing a common problem for first-time life drawers is that the drawing of the model can often become lopsided, or incorrectly angled/positioned. We also discussed foreshortening, and how things being closer to the camera makes parts of them look larger.

Based upon what I learned from sampling the book Figure Drawing For All It’s Worth (1943) by Andrew Loomis, I tried creating some anatomical studies, sketching out the structure of a dog and how the dog walks. Using a real life dog as a reference, and Eadweard Muybridge’s Animal Locomotion, I was able to draw these images, combining this with the knowledge that creating rigs/skeletons can help when drawing 2-D characters. I used observation and photographs of my dog as a basis for these sketches, allowing me to hone my understanding of quadruped anatomy.

summary: Ep. #114 – Feat. Ben Milton and Addy Thomas
title: Ep. #114 – Feat. Ben Milton and Addy Thomas
body:
Ep. #114 – Feat. Ben Milton and Addy Thomas

On this week’s episode, Matt chats with the creators of the Certain POVpodcast and podcast network, Ben Milton and Addy Thomas. They share stories of their old radio days, the start of the podcast, as well as the creation of the network. The guys nerd out about Star Wars, speak about future projects in the works, and talk next steps for the network. Be sure to check out Matt’s other podcasts on…

View On WordPress

summary: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lirCAN0OXNs I think I’ve probably discussed the nigun before; the wordless songs that set the...
caption:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lirCAN0OXNs

I think I’ve probably discussed the nigun before; the wordless songs that set the atmosphere of a Shabbat table or a prayer service.  They can come from many sources, and can be very simple or very elaborate. 

And then … there’s this one.  I’m just going to remind everyone that Star Wars Day (May the Fourth) falls on Shabbat this year.  Use that information wisely, young padawans.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

summary: Hey remember when the Force Awakens came out and we all got excited because FinnPoe was so Obvious and then the execs released a...
body:
Hey remember when the Force Awakens came out and we all got excited because FinnPoe was so Obvious and then the execs released a statement saying they were going to make some changes to the script due to the fan response and we all got SO EXCITED cause they were gonna make the Space Gays Canon but then they ended up removing any and all romantic elements to their friendship and shoehorned in Rose as a stale, forced, no-chemistry relationship that unfolds in like 12 hours like she literally knows Finn for 12 hours before she’s sacrificing herself and professing her love???? That scene where rather than running up to Finn, Poe goes “my droid!” and we’re all just supposed to accept that??? God they just can’t let us Gays have a goddamn thing huh

Anyways Star Wars is overrated
